focus_types.name: Auto Focus
focus_types.description: Automatically adjusts the camera's focus based on its sensors. Ideal for quick shooting and moving subjects.

focus_types.name: Manual Focus
focus_types.description: Gives the photographer full control over the focus. Preferred for precise focusing in macro, portrait, and landscape photography.

focus_types.name: Continuous Auto Focus
focus_types.description: Continuously adjusts focus on a moving subject, useful in sports and wildlife photography.

focus_types.name: Single Point Auto Focus
focus_types.description: Focuses on a single, selected point in the frame. Great for portraits or static subjects.

focus_types.name: Dynamic Auto Focus
focus_types.description: Automatically selects from multiple focus points to track and maintain focus on a moving subject.

focus_types.name: Zone Focusing
focus_types.description: Focuses on a specific zone or area in the frame, useful in street photography and for subjects that move unpredictably.

focus_types.name: Face Detection Focus
focus_types.description: Automatically detects and focuses on human faces, ideal for portraits and group shots.

focus_types.name: Eye Auto Focus
focus_types.description: Specifically focuses on a subject's eyes, perfect for close-up portraits and maintaining sharp focus on the eyes.

focus_types.name: Rack Focus
focus_types.description: A technique where the focus shifts smoothly from one subject to another within the same shot. Commonly used in film to direct attention or create dramatic effect.

focus_types.name: Touch Focus
focus_types.description: Allows the photographer to select the focus point by touching it on the camera's touchscreen. Useful for quick and intuitive focusing.

focus_types.name: Predictive Focus
focus_types.description: Anticipates the movement of a subject to maintain focus on it, particularly useful in fast-paced shooting scenarios like sports.
